result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sidney Gardner

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
STC for 10/31/22 adjourned to 12/15/22 at 1:30 pm on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Notice mailed.
Spoke with Torri in JS at 2:07 pm.

1:45 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sidney Gardner in court. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM816/22CM817/22CT98/22TR3802/22TR4179-4180. Court will vacate the warrants in all the cases and reinstate all the bonds. DE advises the Court that he would like an attorney. Court orders the DE to go to the SPD Office no later than tomorrow (9/23/22) at 4 pm to apply for counsel. DE given directions to the SPD Office in court today.

22TR3802/22TR4179-4180: Court will vacate the default judgments previously entered on 22TR3802, 22TR4179 and 22TR4180.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk NN spoke with DE - Return on Warrant/VA rescheduled to 9/22/22 at 1:30 pm before Judge Gabriele. Clerk NN contacted intake clerk.

DE left multiple messages for Branch 6 clerk while court was in session on 9/20/22. Clerk NN returned phone call on 9/21/22 and DE did not answer; clerk left voicemail regarding scheduling a voluntary appearance before Branch 6 for Cases 22CM816/22CM817/22CT98.

09:46 AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.   No appearance by the Defendant.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CM816/22CM817/22TR3802/22TR4179-80. Based on the DE's non-appearance the Court orders the following:

22CM816: Court authorizes a bench warrant for defendant's arrest with a $500 cash bond and forfeits defendant's bond.

22CM817: Court authorizes a bench warrant for defendant's arrest with a $500 cash bond and forfeits defendant's bond.

22TR3802: Court finds deft guilty by default and imposes $175.30 total fine/costs, 90 DPT or 1 year suspension of driving privileges.

22TR4179: Court finds deft guilty by default and imposes $200.50 total fine/costs, 90 DPT or 1 year suspension of driving privileges.

22TR4180: Court finds deft guilty by default and imposes $175.30 total fine/costs, 90 DPT or 1 year suspension of driving privileges.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
re: Judicial rotation mailed to DE

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

02:14 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Not Guilty Plea entered by the Court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am. $300  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). RB
and witness list filed by the State
